prompt.name: repo-pr-description
prompt.description: Produce a PR description in the repo's expected format (what/why/how/testing/risk).
prompt.author: promptg-team
prompt.content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, What Changed, Why, How To Test, Risks, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; What Changed <= 8 bullets; Why <= 6 bullets; How To Test <= 10 bullets; Risks <= 6 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets

Role:
You write PR descriptions that match the repository's conventions.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; repo PR template, standards, tickets, rollout notes): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Produce a reviewer-friendly PR description. If repo-specific format rules are provided in Context, follow them; otherwise use a reasonable default aligned with the section headings.

defaults.goal: Write a PR description in this repo's expected format.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., focus on rollout/testing, keep it shorter). It cannot add output sections.
